column4: why do i get bash: ./configure: Permission denied when i use ./configure ?? i tried chmod +x too but doesnt work even as root :(
can you tell me how to mount it without noexec? or check if its mounted with that?
check the apropiate line in « cat /proc/mounts  » output
yes you were right. it has noexec. how to remove that? fstab?

do not think so; probably it was mounted via udisks or something like that. try « sudo mount -o remount,exec  /mount/point/ » but i do not see the point of all this; just copy the sources to your home
any idea what should be the umask for file and directory permisions in octal? so that i can exec on that partition?
noexec has nothing to do with permissions. if a partition is noexec you can not execute anything in it no matter the permissions
thanks a lot :)i now know the problem atleast
hi! i tried the way you suggested to convert m4b to ogg. but it didnt work for me. any other ways?
maybe reading my comments and tuhins helps you get some usefull info about what is happening
beggining with --> "cat /proc/cpuinfo" and "sudo cpufreq-info"  output may be of help
yeah i am trying that. i needed to get my subwoofer working :/ well lets do the cpu thingy :)
